text: Germany Bridge was a historic Whipple Truss bridge located near Rochester, Fulton County, Indiana. It was built in 1879 by the Wrought Iron Bridge Co., and spanned the Tippecanoe River. It was a single span iron bridge on cut stone abutments. Note: This includes and Accompanying photographs. It has been demolished and replaced with new span in 1980 It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1978 and delisted in 1980. ==References== Category:Truss bridges in the United States Category:Former National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Bridges completed in 1879 Category:Transportation buildings and structures in Fulton County, Indiana Category:Road bridges in Indiana Category:Wrought iron bridges in the United States Category:Whipple truss bridges in the United States Category:1879 establishments in Indiana
title: Germany Bridge
